sentence: Technology stocks were firming in morning trading, with the shares of tech stocks in the S&P 500 adding nearly 1.0% in value.
(+) Salesforce ( CRM ) shares were more than 8% higher in Wednesday's early session after the customer relationship management software firm reported better-than-expected Q3 financial results.

Excluding one-time items, Salesforce earned $0.61 per share during the three months ended Oct. 31, up from a $0.42 per share adjusted profit during the same quarter last year and beating the Capital IQ consensus of $0.50 per share.
Revenue grew 26% year over year to $3.39 billion, also inching past the $3.37 billion analyst mean.

(=) Red Hat ( RHT ) was steady ahead of Wednesday's opening bell after the open-source software seller Tuesday night announced its acquisition of NooBaa, an early stage company developing software for managing data storage services across hybrid and multicloud environments.
Financial details of the transaction were not disclosed but Red Hat said the deal adding NooBaa's data management technology will augment its existing portfolio of hybrid cloud offerings.

(=) KeyW Holding ( KEYW ) was steady just before the start of Wednesday trading after the security software firm late Tuesday said it received $35 million in new awards and additional work to existing contracts for delivery over the next 12 months to unnamed classified customers.
One contract has the potential to expand by an additional $15 million, KeyW said, adding it will also develop advanced sensor payloads under the contract orders.
